sentences: Teeb ausa n채o p채he ja luiskab.
context: The Estonian word 'aus' is an adjective that primarily means honest, fair, or upright in character and behavior. It can describe a person who tells the truth, keeps promises, and acts with integrity. The word also has extended meanings including being proper/respectable (when referring to people's conduct), being substantial/decent (when describing things), and being respected/esteemed (in older usage). In different contexts it can convey reliability, morality, and ethical behavior.
